name: teamtype
description: Peer-to-peer, editor-agnostic collaborative editing of local text files

repo.name: teamtype
repo.description: Peer-to-peer, editor-agnostic collaborative editing of local text files.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start with comprehensive installation options, but lacks configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No configuration documentation for customizing behavior, connection settings, or advanced options beyond the basic share/join workflow

injection_risks.description: The `sandbox::rename_file` function is called with user-controlled input, which could potentially lead to a path traversal vulnerability.

The `ask` function uses the `format!` macro to construct a string that is then used as input for a user prompt. While this does not directly lead to an injection vulnerability, it could potentially be exploited if the input is not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential path traversal vulnerability in the `sandbox::rename_file` function.
Lack of input validation for the `directory` and `join_code` arguments.
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: File path handling issues (socket creation, config detection)
Editor plugin compatibility and integration bugs
praise_themes: Feature requests show engagement (Zed editor integration, username configuration)
Users proposing reasonable workflow improvements (tmpdir joining)
Good first issue labels indicate maintainer encourages contribution
sentiment.summary: Active community with moderate maintainer engagement showing incremental progress on bugs and features, though some regressions and platform-specific issues indicate the project could benefit from more rigorous testing and clearer documentation.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and encouraging to new contributors. They provide technical depth and address issues with patience.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent
96 open issues with no recent closure activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: This project is abandoned with unaddressed issues accumulating and no development activity for at least 6 months.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-structured, clearly marks breaking changes and provides detailed upgrade instructions. It is comprehensive and easy to understand.

project_metrics.description: Peer-to-peer, editor-agnostic collaborative editing of local text files.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README is well-structured and provides a clear overview of the package, but could benefit from more detailed configuration and troubleshooting documentation.
concerns: Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting guide
Security: Potential path traversal vulnerability in the `sandbox::rename_file` function.
Security: Lack of input validation for the `directory` and `join_code` arguments.
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (300)
A significant number of merged PRs in the past six months (68)
Multiple contributors active in the past six months (7)
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
